title: Family & Relationships
content:
# Family and Relationships

## Family Members
- la familia - family
- el padre/pap√° - father/dad
- la madre/mam√° - mother/mom
- el hermano - brother
- la hermana - sister
- el hijo - son
- la hija - daughter
- el abuelo - grandfather
- la abuela - grandmother
- los padres - parents
- los hermanos - siblings
- los abuelos - grandparents

## Describing Family
- mi - my
- tu - your
- su - his/her/their
- Tengo - I have
- Tiene - He/She has
- mayor - older
- menor - younger

## Common Phrases
- ¬øTienes hermanos? - Do you have siblings?
- Tengo dos hermanas - I have two sisters
- Mi familia es grande - My family is big
- Mi hermano es mayor - My brother is older
- Vivo con mi familia - I live with my family

## Practice Exercises
1. Name family members
2. Describe your family
3. Talk about family relationships
4. Use possessive adjectives

sentences.translation: My family is big.

sentences.translation: I have two brothers.

sentences.translation: My mother's name is Ana.

sentences.translation: Do you have siblings?

sentences.translation: My sister is younger.

sentences.translation: I live with my parents.

sentences.translation: My grandparents are very nice.

lesson_sequence.content:
¬°Hola de nuevo! Welcome back! 
Today we're learning about family - la familia.
Family is very important in Spanish-speaking cultures. Let's learn the words!

First, the most important word: 
LA FAMILIA = Family
Now let's learn about parents - los padres

El padre / Pap√° = Father / Dad 
 La madre / Mam√° = Mother / Mom
Notice: Pap√° and Mam√° are more informal, like 'dad' and 'mom' in English.

content: How do you say 'mother' formally in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Great! Now let's learn about siblings - los hermanos

El hermano = Brother 
 La hermana = Sister

Los hermanos = Siblings 
(both brothers and sisters together)
Now let's learn about children:

El hijo = Son 
 La hija = Daughter
Let's practice matching family members!

Excellent! Now let's learn about
 grandparents - los abuelos

El abuelo = Grandfather 
 La abuela = Grandmother

Los abuelos = Grandparents 
(both grandfather and grandmother)

content: How do you say 'grandfather' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Now let's learn how to talk about YOUR family.

We use possessive words: 
 MI = My 
 TU = Your 
 SU = His/Her/Their

For example: 
 Mi padre = My father 
 Tu hermana = Your sister 
 Su madre = His/Her mother

When we have plural (more than one), we use: 
 Mis = My (plural) 
 Tus = Your (plural) 
 Sus = His/Her/Their (plural)

For example: 
 Mis padres = My parents 
 Tus hermanos = Your siblings

content: How do you say 'my family' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Great! Now let's learn to say you HAVE family members.

Remember 'Tengo' from earlier lessons? 
It means 'I have'!

Tengo = I have 
 Tiene = He/She has 
 ¬øTienes? = Do you have?

You can combine with numbers you learned! 
 Tengo dos hermanos = I have two brothers 
 Tengo una hermana = I have one sister
Perfect! Now let's learn to describe family members as older or younger.

Mayor = Older 
 Menor = Younger

For example: 
 Mi hermano es mayor = My brother is older 
 Mi hermana es menor = My sister is younger

content: If your sister is younger, you say: Mi hermana es...

lesson_sequence.content: Excellent! Now let's practice complete sentences about family.

Remember 'es' means 'is' and you learned it with colors: 
 El cielo es azul = The sky is blue 
 Mi familia es grande = My family is big

You can also combine descriptions: 
 Mi hermano es grande y mayor = My brother is big and older 
 Mi hermana es peque√±a y menor = My sister is small and younger
Great! Now let's learn to say where you live.

Vivo = I live 
 Vive = He/She lives 
 Vivimos = We live
Con = With

So you can say: 
 Vivo con mi familia = I live with my family 
 Vivo con mis padres = I live with my parents

content: How do you say 'I live' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Now let's practice describing family members with their names!

Remember 'se llama' means 'is called/named': 
 Mi padre se llama Juan = My father's name is Juan 
 Mi madre se llama Ana = My mother's name is Ana

content: Ana. Mi padre se llama Juan.

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Let's combine everything we've learned today!

Try to read this: 
 'Hola, mi familia es grande. Tengo dos hermanos y una hermana. Mi hermano mayor se llama Carlos. Mi hermana menor tiene cinco a√±os. Vivo con mis padres y mis abuelos.'

content: In the text above, who is Carlos?
According to the text, who does this person live with?

lesson_sequence.content: Now it's your turn to translate! Let's practice:
Excellent! Now let's do a comprehensive review matching:
Let's practice more complex sentences with fill-in-the-blanks:
Amazing! Now describe this family situation:

content: 'Mis abuelos viven con mi familia.' What does this mean?
MY GRANDPARENTS LIVE WITH MY FAMILY
My parents live with my family
My siblings live with my grandparents

lesson_sequence.content: Let's practice one more matching with all family words:

Final challenge! 
Translate these more complex sentences:

content: My older brother's name is Pedro
Mi hermano mayor se llama Pedro

lesson_sequence.content: ¬°Fenomenal! You've mastered talking about family in Spanish!

You can now: 
 ‚úì Name all family members 
 ‚úì Use possessive adjectives (mi, tu, su) 
 ‚úì Describe family size and relationships 
 ‚úì Say who you live with 
 ‚úì Describe family members as older/younger
¬°Excelente trabajo! Excellent work! You're becoming a real Spanish speaker! üéâ

title: Home & Rooms
content:
# Home and Rooms

## The House
- la casa - house
- el apartamento - apartment
- la habitaci√≥n - room
- la puerta - door
- la ventana - window

## Rooms of the House
- la cocina - kitchen
- el ba√±o - bathroom
- la sala - living room
- el dormitorio - bedroom
- el comedor - dining room
- el jard√≠n - garden

## Furniture & Objects
- la mesa - table
- la silla - chair
- la cama - bed
- el sof√° - sofa
- la televisi√≥n - television
- la l√°mpara - lamp
- el armario - closet

## Describing the Home
- En mi casa - In my house
- Hay - There is/There are
- est√° - is (location)
- aqu√≠ - here
- all√≠ - there
- limpio - clean
- sucio - dirty

## Common Phrases
- Mi casa es peque√±a - My house is small
- En mi casa hay tres dormitorios - In my house there are three bedrooms
- La cocina est√° aqu√≠ - The kitchen is here
- Mi habitaci√≥n es grande - My room is big

## Practice Exercises
1. Name rooms in a house
2. Describe furniture and objects
3. Say what's in your house
4. Use 'hay' and 'est√°' correctly

lesson_sequence.content: ¬°Bienvenido de nuevo! Welcome back! Today we're learning about the house - la casa!
Let's learn the words for different parts of a home.

First, the main word: 
LA CASA = House

Some people live in apartments: 
El apartamento = Apartment

A house has rooms: 
La habitaci√≥n = Room
Every house has doors and windows:

La puerta = Door 
 La ventana = Window

content: How do you say 'house' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Great! Now let's learn the rooms of a house!
La cocina = Kitchen
Remember from earlier? We learned about food in the kitchen!
El ba√±o = Bathroom
La sala = Living room
El dormitorio = Bedroom
El comedor = Dining room
El jard√≠n = Garden
Let's practice matching the rooms!

content: Which of these are rooms in a house?
How do you say 'kitchen' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Excellent! Now let's learn about furniture - los muebles!

Remember these words from earlier lessons? 
La mesa = Table 
 La silla = Chair
Now let's learn more furniture words:
La cama = Bed
El sof√° = Sofa
La televisi√≥n = Television (often shortened to 'la tele')
La l√°mpara = Lamp
El armario = Closet/Wardrobe
Let's practice matching furniture!

content: What do you find in a bedroom?

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Now let's learn how to say what's IN your house.
We use a very important word: HAY = There is / There are

For example: 
Hay una mesa = There is a table 
 Hay dos sillas = There are two chairs

Notice: 'Hay' works for both singular AND plural! 
Hay una cama = There is one bed 
 Hay tres camas = There are three beds

content: How do you say 'there is' or 'there are' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Now we can describe what's in each room!

En mi casa = In my house 
 En la cocina = In the kitchen 
 En el dormitorio = In the bedroom

For example: 
En mi casa hay tres dormitorios = In my house there are three bedrooms

content: En mi casa hay tres dormitorios

lesson_sequence.content: Let's practice more! Fill in the blanks:
Great! Now let's learn to say WHERE things are located.
We use: EST√Å = is (for location)

Along with: 
Aqu√≠ = Here 
 All√≠ = There

For example: 
La cocina est√° aqu√≠ = The kitchen is here 
 El ba√±o est√° all√≠ = The bathroom is there

content: How do you say 'here' in Spanish?
How do you say 'there' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content:
Important difference: 
'ES' = is (description) ‚Üí La casa es grande 
'EST√Å' = is (location) ‚Üí La casa est√° aqu√≠
Excellent! Now let's describe rooms with adjectives we know!

Remember: grande, peque√±o, bonito, nuevo, viejo? 
We can use them with rooms!

Mi habitaci√≥n es grande = My room is big 
 La cocina es peque√±a = The kitchen is small

Let's also learn: 
Limpio = Clean 
 Sucio = Dirty

For example: 
Mi habitaci√≥n es limpia = My room is clean 
 El ba√±o est√° sucio = The bathroom is dirty
Now let's combine everything! Describe rooms with colors and sizes:

Mi dormitorio es grande y azul = My bedroom is big and blue 
 La cocina es peque√±a pero bonita = The kitchen is small but pretty
Let's practice complete descriptions!
Remember 'y' means 'and' and 'pero' means 'but'
En la sala hay un sof√° rojo y una televisi√≥n = In the living room there is a red sofa and a television

content: En la sala hay un sof√° rojo y una televisi√≥n

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Let's practice with numbers too!

Remember: uno, dos, tres, cuatro, cinco... 
You can count rooms and furniture!

En mi casa hay tres dormitorios = In my house there are three bedrooms 
 Hay cinco sillas en el comedor = There are five chairs in the dining room

content: 'En mi casa hay dos ba√±os' means:
IN MY HOUSE THERE ARE TWO BATHROOMS
In my kitchen there are two tables
EN LA COCINA HAY UNA MESA

lesson_sequence.content: Excellent! Now let's practice translation:

content: In my room there is a bed
En mi habitaci√≥n hay una cama

lesson_sequence.content: Let's do more complex matching with everything we learned:
Now describe this house situation:
'Mi casa tiene un jard√≠n grande. En el jard√≠n hay muchas flores. La cocina es peque√±a pero bonita. Hay una mesa roja y tres sillas amarillas.'

What is in the garden according to the text?

lesson_sequence.content: Final challenge! Complete these complex sentences:

content: In my house there are two bathrooms
En mi casa hay dos ba√±os
My bedroom is small but clean
Mi dormitorio es peque√±o pero limpio

lesson_sequence.content: ¬°Fant√°stico! You can now talk about your house and rooms in Spanish!

You learned: 
 ‚úì Parts of a house (doors, windows) 
 ‚úì All the rooms (kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, etc.) 
 ‚úì Furniture items (bed, table, sofa, etc.) 
 ‚úì How to use 'HAY' (there is/are)

¬°Excelente trabajo! Great work! You're making amazing progress! üè†‚ú®

title: Daily Activities & Time
content:
# Daily Activities and Time

## Time Expressions
- el d√≠a - day
- la ma√±ana - morning
- la tarde - afternoon/evening
- la noche - night
- hoy - today
- ma√±ana - tomorrow
- ahora - now
- temprano - early
- tarde - late

## Daily Activities
- comer - to eat
- beber - to drink
- dormir - to sleep
- estudiar - to study
- trabajar - to work
- jugar - to play
- ver - to watch/see
- leer - to read
- escuchar - to listen
- hablar - to speak/talk
- cocinar - to cook
- limpiar - to clean

## Present Tense (AR verbs)
- yo hablo - I speak
- t√∫ hablas - you speak
- √©l/ella habla - he/she speaks

## Common Phrases
- ¬øQu√© haces? - What do you do?
- Por la ma√±ana... - In the morning...
- Por la tarde... - In the afternoon...
- Por la noche... - At night...
- Todos los d√≠as - Every day
- A veces - Sometimes

## Practice Exercises
1. Learn daily activities vocabulary
2. Tell time and talk about parts of the day
3. Describe your daily routine
4. Use present tense verbs
5. Combine activities with time expressions

sentences.sentence: Por la ma√±ana como pan y bebo leche.
sentences.translation: In the morning I eat bread and drink milk.

sentences.sentence: Mi hermano estudia en su habitaci√≥n.

sentences.translation: My mother cooks in the kitchen every day.

lesson_sequence.content: ¬°Buenos d√≠as! Good morning! Today we're learning about daily activities and time!
This lesson combines everything you've learned: family, house, and now what you DO every day!
First, let's learn the parts of the day:
El d√≠a = Day
La ma√±ana = Morning/Tomorrow
'Ma√±ana' can mean MORNING or TOMORROW - context tells you which!
La tarde = Afternoon/Evening
La noche = Night
Remember 'Buenos d√≠as', 'Buenas tardes', 'Buenas noches'? Now you know why!
Now let's learn time expressions:
Hoy = Today
Ahora = Now

Temprano = Early 
 Tarde = Late (yes, also like afternoon!)

content: How do you say 'today' in Spanish?
How do you say 'now' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Now let's learn ACTION WORDS - what you DO every day!
These are called VERBS. Let's start with activities you already know:
Comer = To eat (remember 'comida'?)
Beber = To drink
Dormir = To sleep
Now more activities:
Estudiar = To study
Trabajar = To work
Jugar = To play
Let's learn more activities:
Ver = To watch/see (like watching TV!)
Leer = To read
Escuchar = To listen
Hablar = To speak/talk
Remember these from home? Let's add them:
Cocinar = To cook (in the cocina!)
Limpiar = To clean (making things limpio!)
Great! Now here's the important part: using these verbs to talk about YOU!
In Spanish, verbs CHANGE depending on who does the action.
For 'YO' (I), most -AR verbs end in -O:

Hablar ‚Üí Yo hablo = I speak 
 Cocinar ‚Üí Yo cocino = I cook 
 Estudiar ‚Üí Yo estudio = I study

Usually we don't say 'yo' - just the verb! 
Hablo espa√±ol = I speak Spanish
For -ER verbs like COMER and BEBER:

Comer ‚Üí Como = I eat 
 Beber ‚Üí Bebo = I drink 
 Leer ‚Üí Leo = I read
For -IR verbs:
Vivir ‚Üí Vivo = I live (you know this one!)

content: How do you say 'I eat' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Perfect! Now let's combine activities with TIME!

Por la ma√±ana = In the morning 
 Por la tarde = In the afternoon 
 Por la noche = At night

For example: 
Por la ma√±ana como pan = In the morning I eat bread

Por la tarde estudio = In the afternoon I study 
 Por la noche duermo = At night I sleep
Let's also learn frequency expressions:
Todos los d√≠as = Every day
A veces = Sometimes

For example: 
Cocino todos los d√≠as = I cook every day 
 A veces juego en el jard√≠n = Sometimes I play in the garden

content: How do you say 'sometimes' in Spanish?

lesson_sequence.content: Now let's combine EVERYTHING: time + place + activity!
Remember: En la cocina = In the kitchen, En mi habitaci√≥n = In my room
Por la noche veo la televisi√≥n en la sala = At night I watch TV in the living room

content: Por la noche veo la televisi√≥n en la sala

lesson_sequence.content: Mi madre cocina en la cocina todos los d√≠as = My mother cooks in the kitchen every day

content: Mi madre cocina en la cocina todos los d√≠as

lesson_sequence.content: Let's practice asking and answering questions:
¬øQu√© haces? = What do you do?

You can answer: 
Estudio espa√±ol = I study Spanish 
 Como con mi familia = I eat with my family

Where are you in the morning?
Who do you see in the morning?

lesson_sequence.content: Now let's talk about other people! For √âL/ELLA (he/she):

-AR verbs end in -A: 
Mi padre trabaja = My father works 
 Mi hermana habla = My sister speaks

-ER/-IR verbs end in -E: 
Mi hermano come = My brother eats 
 Mi madre vive aqu√≠ = My mother lives here
Excellent! Now let's describe a full daily routine:
'Por la ma√±ana como el desayuno en el comedor. Por la tarde estudio en mi habitaci√≥n. A veces juego con mi hermano en el jard√≠n. Por la noche veo la televisi√≥n en la sala con mi familia.'

content: According to the text, where does this person study?
What does this person do according to the text?

lesson_sequence.content: Let's practice more complex combinations:
Now let's practice translation with everything you know:

lesson_sequence.content: More complex translations:

content: In the morning I eat in the kitchen
Por la ma√±ana como en la cocina

lesson_sequence.content: Let's do a comprehensive matching exercise:
Final challenge! Complete this daily routine:
Amazing work! Let's practice one more complex scenario:

content: 'Mi hermana lee un libro en su dormitorio todos los d√≠as' - What does she do?
Which activities happen in the kitchen?

lesson_sequence.content: You can now describe your entire day in Spanish!

content: At night I sleep in my bedroom
Por la noche duermo en mi dormitorio
My mother cooks in the kitchen every day
Mi madre cocina en la cocina todos los d√≠as

lesson_sequence.content: ¬°Fenomenal! Fantastic! You've completed all the lessons in Pozna≈Ñ!

You now know: 
 ‚úì All parts of the day (morning, afternoon, night) 
 ‚úì Time expressions (today, tomorrow, now) 
 ‚úì 12+ daily activities 
 ‚úì How to use present tense verbs 
 ‚úì How to describe your daily routine 
 ‚úì How to combine time, place, and activities 
 ‚úì Frequency words (every day, sometimes)

You can now: 
 ‚Ä¢ Talk about your family

¬°Excelente trabajo! Excellent work! You're becoming a real Spanish speaker! Keep practicing! üéâüåü
